intro: Lotononis brachyloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or violet in color, arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
